author: Adrian Santas
comment: Hey there! I had the same issues as most of the users here, while trying to establish a connection with my Fueva 1 lamp for the first time. The app always got stuck at the last step of the connection wizard, with the litlle green circle spinning until the end of times. However, in one of the many attempts after restarting the app, I tried to leave everything as default in the wizard setup and it worked like a charm. With that, I mean that I didn't change either the picture nor the name of the lamp, just hit "next" until it was over and it worked fine. I had another lamp installed in another room, so I tried this method again and it also worked, first try. So there you go, looks like an annoying bug but at least seems to have an easy solution. Later I could change the names and picture of both lamps without any problem or issues with the connection. Hope this helped someone!

reply.author: AwoX
reply.content:
Thanks for your interest in Awox product and for your feedback.

You should be able to customize name and picture in the installation wizard though. 

We will investigate your issue and let you know.

Best regards

AwoX Support
support@awox.com

comment: The app work good without the location not active. But how do I remove the very annoying big red message "Location service is disabled. ENABLE" Location is draining battery... So I don't need it...

author: Terrence Duarte
comment: Too bad the app is wack  C'est bien dommage.. je voyais une belle boite lors de mon achat avec un super produit à l'interieur (un peu chèro mqis bon) qui faisait divers couleurs et intensité et montrant une appli bien propre.. j'ai même acheter une prise Smart.. l'appli c'est du NIM. POR. TE. QUOI !  Faut s'inscrire, ET allumer son BT, ET en plus allumer son GPS.. tout ca pour contrôler une lumière ou avoir des infos sur son usage en électricité..  Autant pour moi, j'aurais du regarder les revues de l'appli qui sont pour la majorité des 1☆. Décû inutilement  DOESNT RESPECT PRIVACY DOESNT DETECT YOUR PRODUCTS, (even at close range and with BT AND GPS ON)

reply.author: AwoX
reply.content:
Bonjour

La création d’un compte est devenue obligatoire depuis le lancement de la gamme Ampoule mesh pour assurer la sécurisation du réseau Bluetooth  mesh.

Avoir un compte unique pour un habitat permet aussi le partage des préférences utilisateurs au sein du même foyer.

Bien cordialement

AwoX Support
support@awox.com

author: Eric Dalton
comment: I would like to know why you need my location for the unit to function, this was not on the package when bought it, thus is an invasion of privacy. I would like an answer!

reply.author: AwoX
reply.content:
Dear customer,
since Android6.0, location / GPS has become mandatory in order to detect and control Bluetooth Low energy devices.
We do not use any stuff regarding your position, but unfortunately Android needs it internally to detect BLE devices.
To be convinced, you can try any free BLE scanner app ...
Best Regards,
AwoX

author: victor G
comment: Can't program multiple schedules

author: Luke Patrick Dunwell
comment: you gotta be flippin' kidding. they ducking REQUIRE a registration to use the lights. absolute NO-GO

author: Ama D.
comment: "out of range" when I'm behind the light???  40s to connect to the light, really random apps, smart pebble work a little better but it's not fine at all.

author: George Balcony
comment: It requires registration to use a Bluetooth device. No reason for this to be mandatory, if I'm not logged in and have no internet, can't I control MY Bluetooth device? Why do I have to share my email to use a Bluetooth device? I've paid for it and I still owe them my email just to turn something on and off? Provide users who want extra features with them by logging in, but let us decide.

reply.author: AwoX
reply.content:
Dear customer,
you just need to create your account once, in order to secure your Bluetooth network, and it also will enable sharing your date and preferences accross several smartphones.
Then, you won't have to login again, and you won't have to be connectet to the internet.
Regards,
AwoX

author: David N
comment: The smartplug is running on Bluetooth, but location needs to be turned on for it to work.  I find it hard to understand the reason for it.  For those of you considering it, I'll advise you'll to save your money unless your house is very small and there's nothing in the path between you and the smartplug.

author: Alex Bainton
comment: Apparently this app has little respect for privacy. The app requests permissions it doesn't need, and then makes you provide an email address. This is for a sync feature, but is wholly unnecessary and should be skippable.  The app is bloated for a simple Bluetooth lamp controller.

author: Nick Jenkey
comment: Out of four lamps purchased only 1 worked with the app, the others either failed to connect having shown as available or worked for a few minutes before not responding.  Whether this is hardware failure or a software issue is irrelevant the product and app fail to work reliably together.  Awaiting a response from technical support

author: Vincenzo Zurita
comment: It doesn't work 95% of the time. Light bulbs just stop responding.

author: Quentin Jericho
comment: I don't understand all the people complaining about this. It's a great app so far, no connectivity issues and the privacy issues were corrected so it's a 5 star for me. Really love it. I'm actually using the light for a home cockpit and it has proven to be really useful.
title: Great app and great lights.
